ABOUT

I am a PhD candidate in Statistical Methods in Economics at the University of Salerno, specializing in Score-Driven Models, State-Space Models, and volatility modeling using high-frequency data. My research focuses on the development and application of advanced statistical methodologies in macroeconomics and finance. My primary empirical interests include the estimation of latent macroeconomic components—such as risk attitudes and uncertainty—the analysis of monetary policy transmission mechanisms, the behavior of real exchange rates, the interaction between the financial and real sectors of the economy, and the quantitative analysis of speculative bubbles in housing and stock markets, as well as inflation dynamics. Looking ahead, my research will expand to include Structural Vector Autoregressive (SVAR) models and Quantile Regression techniques, with the aim of enhancing the methodological framework for empirical macro-finance research.

CV / LinkedIn

RESEARCH INTERESTS

Methodology

  • Score-Driven Models — Developing and applying for macroeconomic and financial time series analysis.
  • State‑Space Models (Kalman Filtering) — Implementing for the estimation of latent macroeconomic components.
  • Financial Econometrics and Volatility Modeling — Constructing score-driven GARCH-type models using high-frequency data to analyze market volatility.

Empirical Applications

  • Monetary Policy — Inflation dynamics, transmission mechanism and transmission channels.
  • Financial sector and the real economy — Risk attitude, risk appetite and uncertainty.
  • Speculative Bubbles — Focus on the housing market, real exchange rate behavior, and the stock market.

Planned Research on Methodological Advancements

  • Structural Vector Autoregressive (SVAR) models
  • Quantile Regression

Publications and Working Papers

  • Estimating the R-Star in the US: A Score-Driven State-Space Model with Time-Varying Volatility Persistence
    Pál, Tibor and Storti, Giuseppe. Working paper.
  • Monetary Policy Models: Lessons from the Eurozone Crisis
    Gutiérrez-Diez, Pedro J. and Pál, Tibor. Nature — Humanities and Social Sciences Communications, October 3, 2023.
  • The Effects of Monetary Policy on House Prices in Spain: The Role of Economic and Monetary Union Membership in the Housing Bubble
    Pál, Tibor. Central European Review of Economics and Management, June 1, 2018.
